intro: Lasiosiphon decaryi var. erectus, commonly known as the upright lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers with prominent, spurred petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
